course.subject: CENG
course.name: Process Dynamics and Control
course.description: Basic concepts, mathematical model, transfer function. Dynamics of first - and higher-order systems. Feedback control, controller tuning, frequency response methods. Cascade control, feedforward and ratio control. Introduction to computer control and multi-variable control. Control and instrumentation hardware.
course.exclusions: ELEC 3200, MECH 3610

reviews.author: zz1900
reviews.title: Good course to know some basics of control
reviews.comment_content: The content covers things like modeling, based on mass/energy balance, laplace transformation, for sloving PDE equations, and some classic controller desgin method for linear time invariant system.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Gao has a good english level to deliever what are necessary for us to understand this course. And he is indeed a true expert with respect to the control field.
The course slides however seem to be a bit redundant, since some contents may never appear in both assignments and examinations, though they can be very scaring at the first glance.
TA are very responsible. The slides they provide are self-contained if you want to have a quick recap and understanding of this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is better than my expectation.
Most mates in this course obtained higher grades than we actually estimate, perhaps the grading criteria can be flexible depanding on the performance of the class in each year.
reviews.comment_workload:
Assignments are a bit much if you want to finish it in a high quality.
Usually takes 1 day to read the slides and finish the assignments
